title: Loading Indicators
excerpt: Designing effective loading states to improve perceived performance.
content:
Loading indicators are crucial UI elements that inform users about ongoing processes, helping to manage expectations and improve perceived performance. They play a vital role in maintaining user engagement during wait times.

Types of Loading Indicators

  • Spinners: Circular animations indicating an indeterminate loading time
  • Progress bars: Linear indicators showing definite progress
  • Skeleton screens: Placeholder UI mimicking the page layout
  • Text indicators: Simple text messages like 'Loading...' or 'Please wait'

Best Practices

  1. Use appropriate indicators: Choose between determinate (progress bars) and indeterminate (spinners) based on the situation
  2. Provide feedback: For longer processes, offer more detailed progress information
  3. Consistency: Use consistent loading indicators throughout your application
  4. Accessibility: Ensure loading states are communicated to screen readers
  5. Avoid false loading: Don't use loading indicators for very quick processes (under 400ms)

Design Considerations

  • Brand alignment: Design loading indicators that match your overall brand aesthetic
  • Size and placement: Ensure indicators are noticeable but not overly distracting
  • Animation: Use smooth, continuous animations to convey ongoing activity
  • Color: Choose colors that provide sufficient contrast and align with your color scheme

Well-designed loading indicators can significantly improve user experience by reducing perceived wait times and providing reassurance that the system is working. They are essential for creating a smooth, responsive feel in your application.
